alert.note: Alert for City of Richmond; Hanover; Henrico; King William; New Kent (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 01 at 8:04PM EDT until April 01 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... The City of Richmond in central Virginia... Northwestern New Kent County in east central Virginia... Northwestern Henrico County in central Virginia... Southeastern Hanover County in central Virginia... Southwestern King William County in east central Virginia... * Until 830 PM EDT. * At 804 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Laurel, or near Virginia Union University, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Mechanicsville and East Highland Park around 810 PM EDT. Highland Springs around 815 PM EDT. Studley around 820 PM EDT. Manquin, Tunstall and Aylett around 830 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Enfield, Central Garage, Hanover Airport, Elmont, Longdale, Westwood, Solomons Store, Chamberlayne, Rumford and Atlee. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.

area.areaDesc: City of Richmond; Hanover; Henrico; King William; New Kent
